application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description:
Removal of existing crazy paving to front and replacement with new grass area. Removal of existing crazy paving to side and replacing with gravel driveway. Existing pathways to be replaced with cobblestone pathways. Existing damaged carport to be removed.
Changing the paint colour of the existing rendered sections of the house from pink to Sandtex Chalk Hill
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The external elevations of the property which are currently pink in colour shall be repainted using Sandtex Ultra Smooth Masonry Paint - Chalk Hill and not any other unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Prior to their use samples/specification of all materials to be used in the formation of the hard-surfaced areas and their method of installation shall be submitted to and approved in writing Local Planning Authority and thereafter the development shall be constructed with the approved materials.

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge the appropriateness of the materials to be used.  Submission of samples prior to commencement will ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area and comply with Policy DC61 of the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.

A fee is required when submitting details pursuant to the discharge of conditions.  In order to comply with the Town and Country Planning (Fees for Applications, Deemed Applications, Requests and Site Visits) (England) Regulations 2012, (as amended), a fee of £116 per request or £34 where the related permission was for extending or altering a dwellinghouse, is needed.
